bibl.title: Hyparchs, Oikonomoi and Mafiosi: The Governance of Judah in the Ptolemaic Period.
bibl.note: Administration in Egypt. - Sources with Regard to Judah: Zenon papyri; - Hecataeus of Abdera; - The Tobiad story. - Decrees of Ptolemy II [C.Ord.Ptol. 21-22]. - Decree of Antiochus III. - Antiochus III and the stratēgos Ptolemy son of Thraseas. - Yehuda coinage. - Discussion. - Conclusions.

bibl.title: Judah between East and West: The Transition from Persian to Greek Rule (ca. 400-200 BCE).

bibl.seg: Grabbe Lester L., Hyparchs, Oikonomoi and Mafiosi: The Governance of Judah in the Ptolemaic Period.

Lester L. Grabbe and Oded Lipschits (Edd.), Judah between East and West: The Transition from Persian to Greek Rule (ca. 400-200 BCE) = Library of Second Temple Studies. 75 (London - New York, 2011) pp. 70-90.

Administration in Egypt. - Sources with Regard to Judah: Zenon papyri; - Hecataeus of Abdera; - The Tobiad story. - Decrees of Ptolemy II [C.Ord.Ptol. 21-22]. - Decree of Antiochus III. - Antiochus III and the stratēgos Ptolemy son of Thraseas. - Yehuda coinage. - Discussion. - Conclusions.
